briefdescription.para: Creates a new BRect object as a copy of other by overloading the = operator.

parameterdescription.para: The BRect object to copy.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not two rectangles coincide exactly.

parameterdescription.para: The BRect to compare with.

simplesect.para: true if the rectangles coincide, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not two rectangles do NOT coincide exactly.

parameterdescription.para: The BRect to compare with.

simplesect.para: true if the rectangles do NOT coincide, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Creates and returns a new BRect that is the intersection of the BRect and other.

detaileddescription.para: The intersection of two rectangles is the area that they both share.

parameterdescription.para: The BRect to take the intersection of.

simplesect.para: A new BRect that is the intersection of the BRect and other.

briefdescription.para: Returns a new BRect that is the union of the BRect and other.

detaileddescription.para: The union of two rectangles is the area that encloses both rectangles.

parameterdescription.para: The BRect to take the union of.

simplesect.para: A new BRect that is the union of the BRect and other.

description.para: Positive values make the rectangle smaller, negative values make it larger.
The …Self() versions also return the transformed BRect when they are done. The …Copy() versions transform a copy without changing the original.

briefdescription.para: Inset the BRect by the x and y coordinates of point.

parameterdescription.para: The point to use to inset the BRect.

briefdescription.para: Inset the BRect by dx units in the horizontal direction and dy units in the vertical direction.

parameterdescription.para: The horizontal distance to inset the BRect by.
The vertical distance to inset the BRect by.

briefdescription.para: Like BRect::InsetBy() but returns the transformed BRect.

parameterdescription.para: The point to use to inset the BRect.

briefdescription.para: Like BRect::InsetBy() but returns the transformed BRect.

parameterdescription.para: The horizontal distance to inset the BRect by.
The vertical distance to inset the BRect by.

briefdescription.para: Like BRect::InsetBy() but returns a copy of the transformed BRect leaving the original unmodified.

parameterdescription.para: The point to use to inset the BRect.

simplesect.para: A copy of the BRect after it has been transformed.

briefdescription.para: Like BRect::InsetBy() but returns a copy of the transformed BRect leaving the original unmodified.

parameterdescription.para: The horizontal distance to inset the BRect by.
The vertical distance to inset the BRect by.

simplesect.para: A copy of the BRect after it has been transformed.

description.para: Positive values move the rectangle right and down, negative values move the rectangle left and up.
The …Self() versions also return the translated BRect when they are done. The …Copy() versions translate a copy without changing the original.

briefdescription.para: Moves the BRect horizontally by the x value of point and vertically by y value of point without changing the size of the rectangle.

parameterdescription.para: The point to use to move the rectangle.

briefdescription.para: Moves the BRect horizontally by dx units and vertically by dy units point without changing the size of the rectangle.

parameterdescription.para: The number of units the move the rectangle vertically.
The number of units the move the rectangle horizontally.

briefdescription.para: Move the BRect to the location specified by point.

parameterdescription.para: The location to move the BRect to.

briefdescription.para: Move the BRect to the point specified by the given x and y coordinates.

parameterdescription.para: The vertical coordinate of the point to move the BRect to.
The horizontal coordinate of the point to move the BRect to.

briefdescription.para: Like BRect::OffsetBy() but returns the translated BRect.

parameterdescription.para: The point to use to move the rectangle.

briefdescription.para: Like BRect::OffsetBy() but returns the translated BRect.

parameterdescription.para: The number of units the move the rectangle vertically.
The number of units the move the rectangle horizontally.

briefdescription.para: Like BRect::OffsetBy() but returns a copy of the translated BRect leaving the original unmodified.

parameterdescription.para: The point to use to move the rectangle.

simplesect.para: A copy of the BRect after it has been translated.

briefdescription.para: Like BRect::OffsetBy() but returns a copy of the translated BRect leaving the original unmodified.

parameterdescription.para: The number of units the move the rectangle vertically.
The number of units the move the rectangle horizontally.

simplesect.para: A copy of the BRect after it has been translated.

briefdescription.para: Like BRect::OffsetTo() but returns the translated BRect.

parameterdescription.para: The point to use to move the rectangle.

briefdescription.para: Like BRect::OffsetTo() but returns the translated BRect.

parameterdescription.para: The vertical coordinate of the point to move the BRect to.
The horizontal coordinate of the point to move the BRect to.

briefdescription.para: Like BRect::OffsetTo() but returns a copy of the translated BRect leaving the original unmodified.

parameterdescription.para: The point to use to move the rectangle.

simplesect.para: A copy of the BRect after it has been translated.

briefdescription.para: Like BRect::OffsetTo() but returns a copy of the translated BRect leaving the original unmodified.

parameterdescription.para: The number of units the move the rectangle vertically.
The number of units the move the rectangle horizontally.

simplesect.para: A copy of the BRect after it has been translated.

briefdescription.para: The value of the rectangle's bottom edge.
The value of the rectangle's left edge.
The value of the rectangle's right edge.
The value of the rectangle's top edge.
Creates an empty BRect object with dimensions (0, 0, -1, -1).

detaileddescription.para: These dimensions are invalid, use Set() to provide valid dimensions.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new BRect object with its dimensions defined by the leftTop and rightBottom points.

parameterdescription.para: The position to set the left top corner to.
The position to set the bottom right corner to.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new BRect object with its dimensions defined by the leftTop point and size.

parameterdescription.para: The position of the left top corner.
The size of the rect defining its width and height.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new BRect object as a copy of other.

parameterdescription.para: The BRect object to copy.

memberdef.argsstring: (float left, float top, float right, float bottom)
memberdef.name: BRect

briefdescription.para: Creates a new BRect object with the given dimensions.

parameterdescription.para: The left dimension.
The top dimension.
The right dimension.
The bottom dimension.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new BRect object setting the left and top dimensions to 0 and setting the right and bottom dimensions to side - 1.

parameterdescription.para: The dimension to set the right and bottom sides.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not the BRect contains point.

parameterdescription.para: The point to test.

simplesect.para: true if the BRect contains point, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not the BRect wholly contains rect.

parameterdescription.para: The rectangle to test.

simplesect.para: true if the BRect contains rect, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the height of the rectangle.

simplesect.para: The height of the rectangle as a float.

briefdescription.para: Returns The height of the rectangle rounded using ceil(bottom - top).

simplesect.para: The height of the rectangle as an int32.

briefdescription.para: Returns The width of the rectangle rounded using ceil(right - left).

simplesect.para: The width of the rectangle as an int32.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not the BRect and rect intersect.

parameterdescription.para: The BRect to use to test for intersection.

simplesect.para: true if the rectangles intersect, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not the BRect is valid.

detaileddescription.para: A BRect is valid if its width and height are non-negative, that is its right value is greater than or equal to its left value and its bottom value is greater than or equal to its top value.

simplesect.para: true if the BRect is valid, false if the BRect is invalid.

briefdescription.para: Returns the left bottom point of the BRect.

simplesect.para: The left bottom point as a BPoint.

briefdescription.para: Returns the left top point of the BRect.

simplesect.para: The left top point as a BPoint.

briefdescription.para: Prints the BRect dimensions to standard output.

detaileddescription.para: The format of the output looks like this: BRect(l:%.1f, t:%.1f, r:%.1f, b:%.1f).

briefdescription.para: Returns the right bottom point of the BRect.

simplesect.para: The right bottom point as a BPoint.

briefdescription.para: Returns the right top point of the BRect.

simplesect.para: The left right point as a BPoint.

memberdef.argsstring: (float left, float top, float right, float bottom)
memberdef.name: Set

briefdescription.para: Sets the dimensions of a BRect.

parameterdescription.para: The left dimension to set.
The top dimension to set.
The right dimension to set.
The bottom dimension to set.

briefdescription.para: Sets the left bottom point of the BRect.

parameterdescription.para: The point to set.

briefdescription.para: Sets the left top point of the BRect.

parameterdescription.para: The point to set.

briefdescription.para: Sets the right bottom point of the BRect.

parameterdescription.para: The point to set.

briefdescription.para: Sets the right top point of the BRect.

parameterdescription.para: The point to set.

briefdescription.para: Returns the dimensions of the BRect.

simplesect.para: The dimensions of the BRect as a BSize.

briefdescription.para: Returns the width of the rectangle.

simplesect.para: The width of the rectangle as a float.

briefdescription.para: Defines a rectangular area aligned along pixel dimensions.

detaileddescription.para: BRect's are used throughout the Interface Kit to define the frames of windows, views, and bitmaps. BRect's are always oriented with completely vertical and horizontal lines, they cannot be rotated.

A BRect must have a non-negative width and height to be valid, that is the left value must be greater than or equal to the right value and the bottom edge value be greater than or equal to the top value. You can test whether or not a BRect is valid by calling IsValid(). Nothing prevents you from creating an invalid BRect, but, using one to define an area can produce unpredictable results.
A gotcha of using BRect's is that the starting point is 0, not 1, so in order to create a BRect with a 32x32 pixel area you write:
or if you have the width and height stored in a variable you subtract 1 like this:
